title: Ticket #1534: Configs with pipes on Windows pops up a cmd window when configs read
description:
Mostly a Win32 annoyance. When you use configuration with pipes:

LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE = $(BIN)\fetch_config.exe http://192.168.0.106/condor/config/$(FULL_HOSTNAME) |

On windows, any time Condor fetches the config you'll get a flash of a cmd window on the screen as the pipe to the executable is opened by Condor to read the configuration.

It's a minor annoyance. Calls to condor_status, condor_q, etc. trigger it.

It's got to do with how Condor spawns the process for the pipe. Here's a SO question that deals with the same thing and proposes a solution:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/780465/winapi-createprocess-but-hide-the-process-window

Any chance we could get that implemented for 7.5.x?

Regards,

- Ian
